title: How to Make Ricotta and Tomato Tart

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F, 200 degrees C, or on gas mark 6.
Add the tomatoes to a colander and season them with salt.
steps.description: Drain and leave them in for about 10 minutes.

steps.headline: Place the pre-rolled pastry on a baking tray and put it to one side.
Make the ricotta filling.
steps.description: Mix the ricotta, eggs, cream, Parmesan, nutmeg, salt and pepper in a bowl. Then add the rocket leaves and stir.

steps.headline: Make the tart.
Bake the tart in the oven for about 35 to 40 minutes or until the pastry is golden brown.
Sprinkle with oregano and cut the tart into slices.

text:
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F, 200 degrees C, or on gas mark 6. Add the tomatoes to a colander and season them with salt. Drain and leave them in for about 10 minutes. Place the pre-rolled pastry on a baking tray and put it to one side. Make the ricotta filling. Mix the ricotta, eggs, cream, Parmesan, nutmeg, salt and pepper in a bowl. Then add the rocket leaves and stir. Make the tart. Add the cheese mixture to the center of the pastry. Spread the filling over the dough and leave about a 5 centimeter border around the outside. Use your hand to lift and push the border over and onto the filling. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/74/Make-Ricotta-and-Tomato-Tart-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Ricotta-and-Tomato-Tart-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/74/Make-Ricotta-and-Tomato-Tart-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-Ricotta-and-Tomato-Tart-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Arrange the tomato slices over the top of the filling and brush the tart with the egg yolk. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/74/Make-Ricotta-and-Tomato-Tart-Step-5Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Ricotta-and-Tomato-Tart-Step-5Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/74/Make-Ricotta-and-Tomato-Tart-Step-5Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-Ricotta-and-Tomato-Tart-Step-5Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Bake the tart in the oven for about 35 to 40 minutes or until the pastry is golden brown. Sprinkle with oregano and cut the tart into slices.
